🔥 Trained with 40% more data (2T tokens) than LLama 1 and 2x context length

👑 Outperforms other OS models
🤗 Available on Azure, HuggingFace + more

This is going to change the landscape of the LLM market.
Llama-v2 is available on Microsoft Azure and will be available on AWS, Hugging Face and other providers

Pretrained and fine-tuned…

activity.text:
Voicebox, a new generative speech model. What can it do? Here are some examples:

1. Transient noise removal. Getting interrupted by doorbell while recording speech? Voicebox can be used like a magic eraser to remove transient noise.

2. Content editing. Voicebox can also help…

quoted.text:
Introducing Voicebox, a new breakthrough generative speech system based on Flow Matching, a new method proposed by Meta AI. It can synthesize speech across six languages, perform noise removal, edit content, transfer audio style & more.

More details on this work & examples ⬇️

activity.text: See and hear sample examples here: https://t.co/sn1uMIrgyR

activity.text: It's 2023, and I'm surprised that Gmail's spam filter is still way better than every other email provider's

CodeCompose paper: https://t.co/hyoKq8M4GR

The paper presents CodeCompose, an AI code generation and completion LLM developed and deployed at Meta internally. 

8% of the code typed by users of CodeCompose is through accepting code suggestions from CodeCompose. https://t.co/4TvalhB6Sw

activity.text:
New Paper Alert 🚨 Speech translation can be hard when there is music or background noise. We've trained a model that also uses visual cues (not just sound) to get better results.

Paper: https://t.co/tUb8U34iUZ
Github: https://t.co/vpSsuEoqsN
Blog: https://t.co/oO92GITbvk https://t.co/U3q7ShGiK7

quoted.text:
MuAViC is a new benchmark for audio-visual learning for robust speech translation.

Using MuAViC, we trained our AV-HuBERT model to translate speech in challenging settings using sound + sight, achieving results outperforming other leading translation models.

More details ⬇️

activity.text: Work by: Mohamed Anwar, @BowenShi20, @vedanujg, @mhnt1580, @ChanghanWang, @juanmiguelpino, @MetaAI

activity.text:
Some problems ask for a right or wrong answer. Other problems have a range of acceptable answers.

Today's AI applications will likely find more success in solving for the latter, than the former.
Wow, the contestants on Physical 100 are beasts. These games are literally torture.
Obviously, street parking in San Francisco is a bad idea, but what about parking garages in Soma? Will my fancy Tesla get broken into?
@mattmireles Not completely same as a garage, but I’ve had my car broken into before in a fenced off parking lot in SOMA

replyTo.text: Obviously, street parking in San Francisco is a bad idea, but what about parking garages in Soma? Will my fancy Tesla get broken into?

activity.text:
We are releasing LLaMA, a collection of foundational LLMs 7B to 65B in size. LLaMA-13B outperforms GPT-3 175B on most benchmarks. LLaMA-65B is competitive with the best models, Chinchilla70B and PaLM-540B

Paper: https://t.co/LnnlWE25Fr

Apply for access: https://t.co/ZkC2IxKbsM

quoted.text:
Today we're publicly releasing LLaMA, a state-of-the-art foundational LLM, as part of our ongoing commitment to open science, transparency and democratized access to new research.

Learn more & request access ➡️ https://t.co/8AeLVhMWkq https://t.co/1BEkTngtnM

activity.text: Sometimes I wish I still had the old Google Finance user interface.

My first internship was at Bing (then MSN Search). I didn't know much, but I do remember the team's relentless optimism of taking on Google, despite not even surpassing Yahoo yet at the time.

It's actually impressive how they've never given up after all these years.

Everyone is talking about Google vs. OpenAI/Bing for 'search.'

Meanwhile, TikTok has quietly become the default search engine for Gen Z
@blakeir I would really like to see a LLM implementation on Twitter Search

replyTo.text:
Everyone is talking about Google vs. OpenAI/Bing for 'search.'

Meanwhile, TikTok has quietly become the default search engine for Gen Z

activity.text: In 2017, I was getting my ass kicked at FB. My manager told me to study the LSAT to improve my argumentation and logic skills. I don't know if he thought I'd take him seriously, but I did the LSAT prep  and it 100% changed my trajectory. Biggest +ev advice in recent memory.
@morganb Music to my ears that all my time spent studying for standardized tests might've actually been useful!

replyTo.text: In 2017, I was getting my ass kicked at FB. My manager told me to study the LSAT to improve my argumentation and logic skills. I don't know if he thought I'd take him seriously, but I did the LSAT prep  and it 100% changed my trajectory. Biggest +ev advice in recent memory.

activity.text: Generative AI does not copy existing works, but the principles by which existing work has been constructed. With each generation, the models don't necessarily get closer to what a particular artist or author produced, but to what they would have produced.
@Plinz Seems so. It's also difficult to explain it entirely.

replyTo.text: Generative AI does not copy existing works, but the principles by which existing work has been constructed. With each generation, the models don't necessarily get closer to what a particular artist or author produced, but to what they would have produced.

activity.text: Trying to figure out how to make this more community run, very open to ideas (DMs open)

quoted.text: We just launched Twitter Tips (a la Techmeme: https://t.co/lcsnYTm9jK). Just include "Tip @bleedingedgeai" in your message along with the URL of the post you'd like to appear. We're adding attribution shortly too.

New to generative AI and want to learn? Here are some resources

- AI For PMs: https://t.co/P7fwxyuwJQ

- Intro to Diffusion Models: https://t.co/sID48dYtD1

- Large Language Models (Stanford CS324): https://t.co/hvBxBWf98k
RT @Patrick_Lung: And Instagram is the #1 dapp on rainbow now. Excited to see  NFTs continue reaching mainstream audiences 🙌

Thanks to @MetaAI for adding a demo for SpeechMatrix, a dataset with 136 language pairs and a total of 418,000 hours of speech, along with a Hokkien translation. 

Try out the @Gradio demos on @huggingface:

Hokkien: https://t.co/eCOQl1CMxm
SpeechMatrix: https://t.co/KxirDRfpAF
@huggingface @MetaAI @Gradio 🤗🤗

activity.text: Every time I walk by The Melt I think about how Mike Moritz (Sequoia), 1 of the best investors ever - led a $10M seed round (insane for the time) in a grilled cheese company & recruited Michael Mina and Ron Johnson, but ultimately it was just bread and cheese, not a tech company. https://t.co/Jayi9MePFC
@pitdesi I quite like this place

activity.text: The year in the Bay Area feels like the seasons have turned: Getting darker earlier, Warriors season underway, so many amazing founders in the Bay Area, plenty of competing social events each night, but also a sharpening tightening of capital ad the year nears the end.
@semil Feel the same. A new chapter has begun.
